title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 66-2.6 - Exclusion of susceptibles in the event of a disease outbreak
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 66-2.6 - Exclusion of susceptibles in the event of a disease outbreak

State Regulations
(a) In the event of an outbreak of measles, mumps or rubella in an institution, the commissioner may order the appropriate officials of the institution to exclude from attendance all students without documentation of immunity as specified in section
66-2.2
(b) or (c)
and those who have been excused from immunization under section
66-2.2
(d) or (e)
of this Subpart. (b) The exclusion shall continue until the commissioner determines that the danger of transmission has passed or until the documentation specified in section
66-2.2
(b) or (c)
of this Subpart has been submitted. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10
§§
66-2.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
